page.title: 02COMMUNICATIONS : F.COMPTON.
page.content: The grid area is crossed from N.to S. by the A 423 Trunk Road which comes from Coventry in the North & goes to Banbury and Oxford in the South.The village area lies at the junction of two minor roads linking it to nearby villages and to the A41 Trunk Road, which lies to the South & joins Warwick and Oxford.Minor roads service most areas within the grid,& footpaths link farms to the village area. The Oxford Canal loops into the area,and joins Fenny Compton by water to Oxford & the Thames, to Nottingham and the Trent,and via Coventry to Birmingham & to Liverpool. There are no direct rail links - the nearest British Rail Station is at Banbury. There are two local buses daily, and schoolchildren are transported daily from home to school & back where the distance is 3 miles or over;this service is free.
